Meaning: to compare, make a comparison, compete, vie
S1: 日本語の発音は英語に比べればやさしい。
T1: The pronunciation of Japanese is rather easy compared to that of English.
S2: 去年に比べて今年は収穫量が少ない。
T2: The harvest totals are relatively meager compared with last year.
S3: ロンドンはパリに比べると大きい。
T3: When compared to Paris, London is large.

Meaning: to live, exist, make a living, be in effect, be in use, function, come to life
S1: 生物は酸素なしでは生きられない。
T1: Living things cannot live without oxygen.
S2: この法律は生きている。
T2: This law is still in effect.
S3: 彼女はお花の先生をして生きている。
T3: She earns her living by teaching flower arrangement.

Meaning: to keep, within limits, restrain, control, curb, hold in check, hold back, suppress
S1: 輸出を抑える。
T1: Restrict exports.
S2: これは胃酸の分泌を抑える薬です。
T2: This is a drug that suppresses the secretion of stomach acid.
S3: お客様の立場に立って値段を抑えてあります。
T3: We keep our prices low from the customer's point of view.

Meaning: to divide, split, part, separate, share, distribute, break up, distinguish, differentiate
S1: 費用を半分ずつに分ける。
T1: Split the cost in half.
S2: 衣類を夏物と冬物に分ける。
T2: Separate clothing into summer and winter
S3: 仕事と遊びはきっちり分けて考えている。
T3: I make a clear distinction between work and play.

Meaning: to be separated, be apart, be distant, leave, go away, quit, give up, drift away
S1: 親から離れて暮らす。
T1: Live away from parents.
S2: 大学を離れて企業で研究する。
T2: Leaving the university to do research in a company.
S3: 家が 2 軒離れて建っている。
T3: Two houses are built two houses apart.

Meaning: to be based on, take into account, build upon, have origin in, firmly planted on
S1: 経験を踏まえた助言。
T1: Advice based on experience.
S2: 事実を踏まえた考察。
T2: Consideration based on facts.
S3: 過去のデータを踏まえて予測する。
T3: Forecasting based on historical data

Meaning: to respond, satisfy, accept, comply with, apply for
S1: 呼びかけに応じてにっこり笑う。
T1: Smile in response to a call.
S2: 申し入れに快く応じる。
T2: Accept a proposal with pleasure.
S3: 私は喜んで彼女の招待に応じた。
T3: I gladly accepted her invitation.

Meaning: to endeavour, try, strive, make an effort, exert oneself, be diligent, be committed
S1: 妻としての務めを果たそうと努めた。
T1: She endeavored to do her duty as a wife.
S2: 会社の発展に努める。
T2: Make an effort to expand the company.
S3: 国は社会福祉の向上に努めなければならない。
T3: The State must strive to improve social welfare

Meaning: to be temperate in, refrain, abstain, hold back, restrain, be prepare for, wait for, be in close relationship
S1: 車内での通話はお控えください。
T1: Please refrain from talking on the phone in the train.
S2: 双方の言い分を聞くまで判断を控えます。
T2: I'll reserve judgment until I hear both sides of the story.
S3: 彼の後ろに看護師が控えていた。
T3: He had a nurse standing behind him.

Meaning: to finish, graduate
S1: 大学の課程を終える。
T1: Finish the university course.
S2: その日の日程を終える。
T2: Finish the day's itinerary.
S3: 首脳会談はその 3 日間の日程を無事に終えた。
T3: The summit successfully completed its three-day schedule.

Meaning: to visit, call on, pay a visit to
S1: 京都の神社仏閣を訪ねた。
T1: We visited temples and shrines in Kyoto.
S2: 僕が東京にいるうちに訪ねてきてくれ。
T2: Come and see me while I'm in Tokyo.
S3: 修学旅行以来奈良を訪ねるのはこれが初めてだ。
T3: This is the first time I've visited Nara since my school trip.

Meaning: to hang, suspend, wear, lower, reduce, bring down, demote, move back, clear, remove
S1: 機長は機首を下げた。
T1: The captain lowered the nose of the plane.
S2: 天井から電灯を下げる。
T2: Hang an electric light from the ceiling.
S3: 値札の半値に下げる。
T3: Reduce the price to half of the price tag

Meaning: to put up,  hang out, fly, hoist, raise, display, hold up, tout, publish, print, tuck up, roll up
S1: 表札を掲げる。
T1: Put up a nameplate.
S2: 私たちはランプを高く掲げて合図した。
T2: We signaled by holding our lamps high.
S3: 市中至るところに国旗が掲げてあった。
T3: The national flag was being displayed everywhere in the city.

Meaning: to catch, stop the blow, react to, take, accept, come to grips with
S1: 批判を前向きに受け止める。
T1: Respond to criticism positively.
S2: ボールを片手で受け止めた。
T2: He caught the ball with one hand.
S3: 敵の攻撃を受け止める。
T3: Stop the enemy's attack.

Meaning: to collect, assemble, gather
S1: 切手をたくさん集めている。
T1: He collects a lot of stamps.
S2: その学校は優秀な教師を集めている。
T2: That school attracts the best teachers.
S3: この車は最高の技術を集めて作られた。
T3: This car was built by bringing together technologies of the highest level.

Meaning: to spread, extend, expand, enlarge, widen, unfold, open. unroll, make flourish
S1: 鳥が翼を広げた。
T1: The bird spread its wings.
S2: 川幅を広げる。
T2: Widen a river.
S3: 部屋中に資料を広げて論文を書いている。
T3: She’s writing a paper with materials spread all over the room.

Meaning: to respond, answer, meet, affect, take a toll, have an effect on, be hard on someone
S1: 電話での依頼に応えて医者がすぐ来た。
T1: The doctor came right away in response to my phone request.
S2: 両親の期待に応えられなかった。
T2: He couldn't live up to his parents' expectations.
S3: この寒さは患者の体に応える。
T3: This cold weather affects the patients.

Meaning: to lower, be lowered
S1: 声を低める。
T1: Lower your voice.
S2: 腰を低める。
T2: Crouch down.
S3: 薬を使って正常値の範疇に低めるのは常識です。
T3: It is common sense to use drugs to lower them into the normal range.

Meaning: to match, join together, unite, combine, add up, face, be opposite, compare, cause to meet
S1: 柔道とボクシングを合わせた手を使う。
T1: Use a combination of judo and boxing moves.
S2: 調味料を合わせる。
T2: Mix seasonings together.
S3: バイオリンの調子をピアノに合わせた。
T3: I tuned the violin to the piano.

Meaning: to accept, receive, agree
S1: 彼の主張は受け入れられなかった。
T1: His claim was not accepted.
S2: 日本は西洋の文化を受け入れて来た。
T2: Japan has been receptive to Western culture.
S3: その病院は事故の負傷者を50名受け入れた。
T3: That hospital admitted 50 people injured in the accident.
Words: 受入れる。受け容れる。受けいれる

Meaning: to collapse, crumble, get out of shape, disorganised, break down, disarray, crash, slump, turn bad
S1: 雪の重みで屋根が崩れた。
T1: The roof collapsed under the weight of the snow.
S2: 雨でがけが崩れた。
T2: The cliff collapsed because of the rain.
S3: この手の上着は形がなかなか崩れません。
T3: This kind of jacket does not lose its shape easily

Meaning: to hold in one's arms, have problems, take on, be burdened with, employ
S1: 小脇に抱える。
T1: Carry something under one's arm.
S2: 運転手を抱える。
T2: Employ a chauffeur.
S3: 彼は体に時限爆弾を抱えている。
T3: His health could fail him at any moment.

Meaning: to pin down, hold down, press down, cover, clutch, press, get a hold of, obtain, grasp
S1: はしごを押さえていてくれ。
T1: Hold the ladder.
S2: 私は着物のすそを押さえながら歩いた。
T2: I walked holding down the skirts of my kimono with my hand.
S3: 重要書類が捜査当局の手に押さえられた。
T3: Important documents were seized by investigators.

Meaning: to feel, sense, experience
S1: 彼は生命の危険を感じた。
T1: He felt his life was in danger.
S2: めまいを感じる。
T2: Feel dizzy.
S3: 根回しの必要を痛切に感じる。
T3: I feel keenly the need to put down roots.
